Marissa dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, a 45-year-old resident of Cloocan City, Philippines. She is a widowed mother of six children, three of whom are working and have their own families, while the other three are still studying. By the grace of God, Elvira has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her other three children to college.

Elvira operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store retailing groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. She also uses a small area of her house for videoke machine rental where people can hang out and sing. A videoke is a combined term for video karaoke. She also earns income from renting out the machines for special occasions, her regular customers being her neighbors and the local community. Elvira earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her videoke machines. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Elvira hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to support her children's schooling up to college level. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Shemus

texts.en:
Shemus, a 29-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur, is married to a motorcycle taxi driver and the mother of three children, all in school. The operator of an enterprise called Berwa since 2007, Shemus originally offered only tailoring services but now has expanded to include the sale of fabrics. She will use this loan to purchase additional fabric that she will both sell and use to make clothing.

With her business profits, Shemus plans to pay the school fees for her children and also accumulate savings for her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 37-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with five children between the ages of 3 and 19. Her husband works with the local authorities, and all of her children are in school.

Since 1999, Beatrice has been running a general store that originally sold only charcoal but now carrles many other items as well. She will use this loan to purchase goods such as maize flour, rice, and milk to meet the growing demand of her customers. With her business profits, Beatrice plans to pay the school fees for her children and provide for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, milk, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is involved in multiple businesses. She sells materials, watermelon and other types of fruits at Elmina. She is single and has 2 children. Her ex-husband husband assists to pay school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more fruits to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Abena Philomena

texts.en: Abena is married and has three children. She sells provisions and cooks food such as rice and stew for sale at Elmina. Her husband is a farmer. Abena uses her income to assist her husband to pay utility bills and other household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase cooking oil, rice and other ingredients to cook and sell. She plans to reinvest the new profits back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice and other ingredients to cook and sell.

loans.name: Magart

texts.en: Magart is married and has three children. She sells food items such as cassava, maize, canned tomatoes and onions at Kokoado near Elmina, which she has done for eight years. Her husband is a farmer. She supports him in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Magart will use the loan to purchase a sack of onions and canned tomatoes for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Magaret plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of onions and canned tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Pitiriba

texts.en:
Pitiriba is single and has two children. She operates a food joint where she sells varieties of foods such as fufu, banku and other items at Elmina, which she has done for nine years. She will use the loan to purchase food stuffs to cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Pitiriba plans to build a better restaurant.

In the picture, she is getting the cassava ready to be used for the fufu. In Ghana, fufu is mostly made from boiled cassava and unripe plantain beaten together, as well as from cocoyam. It is a thick paste usually made by boiling starchy root vegetables in water and pounding with a mortar and pestle until the desired consistency is reached.

loans.use: to purchase food stuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Squatting, Ekua has her left hand on some tubers of cassava. She trades in cassava and maize at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is single and has five dependents. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and educating her children. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava and maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and maize to sell.

loans.name: Godeliva

texts.en:
Godeliva, 31, is a Rwandan entrepreneur. She is married to a driver and has three children, aged one to 12, all of whom are in school apart from the youngest.

Since 2003, she has been successfully running a restaurant. She will use this loan to purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant such as tea, donuts, french fries, meat and other traditional African foods.

With the profits from her restaurant, she hopes to develop herself as a business woman and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a single parent taking care of six children. She sells provisions such as toffee, milo, powdered milk and other items at Elmina, which she has done for six years. She wants to sell more types of provisions and will use this loan from Kiva to buy these. Her future plan for the business is to open another branch in a different village.

loans.use: to buy other varieties of provisions to sell.

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en: In the picture, Magaret is standing in front of her provisions shop at Dompoase, a village near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher. She responsibly assists her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy sugar, milo, and milk (provisions to sell). She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milo, and milk for resale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is single and has six children. She cooks “piwa”, a local dish made from corn which is boiled like rice (the dried maize or corn is broken into pieces which look like grains of rice). She sells the dish at Elmina, which she has done for eight years. Rita will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to store and then use to prepare the dish to sell, as the price of maize keeps increasing. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize to store and later use to prepare a dish for sale, as the price of maize keeps increasing.

loans.name: Doris Ama

texts.en:
In this picture, Doris has some baked pastries and to the right, some baking tins are arranged. She is married and has three children. 

Doris has been baking for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer and Doris, as part of her responsibilities, assists him to pay school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake for distribution. Doris wishes to reinvest  the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake for distribution.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa cooks etew (banku), as it is popularly called by people in the Central Region of Ghana. Her business is situated in the community of Elmina and is five years old. She is married and has 10 children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa takes care of her home. Her loan will be used to buy maize to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy maize to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana sells maize at Elmina.  She is also into gari processing (as shown in the picture above). She is a single parent who is currently taking care of five children.  She has been in this business for six years. She is solely responsible for the education, feeding and clothing of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of cassava to process for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bags of cassava to process

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 24 years old and married with two children.  She does tailoring to earn a living for her family.  She was previously employed.  She joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she could save her money and access financial resources easily because the group members guarantee each other's loans. Mary hopes to grow her business by getting more clients.  She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena sells maize and gari at Elmina. To prepare the gari, she gets raw fresh cassavas from the market. She washes and peels the cassavas and then sends them to the mill to be milled into dough. She puts the dough in a sack and places heavy stones on it. The stones are placed to drain the starch out of the dough. She leaves the dough for a day or two depending on the weight of the stones. After this process, she stir fries the gari in a pan on the fire. The gari is then left to cool and bagged into small bags for sale. 

Gari is a starchy food in Ghana that is mostly enjoyed by students and large families. Students eat gari a lot because it is a quick and easy food to prepare. They soak the gari mix with condensed milk and water, and sometimes add peanuts. Some students also prepare gari in the form of dough and eat it with pepper sauce and sardines.

Families also eat gari for lunch or supper, usually served with soup or pepper sauce. The soups that are mostly accompanied by gari are okra soup, groundnut (peanut) soup, palm nut soup, and vegetable soup. Various sauces can also be used to eat gari such as pepper sauce, curry sauce, and tomato sauce. The variety of the sauce served with gari depends on the family’s preferences. Any kind of meat or fish can be eaten with these soups and sauces. Gari is a Ghanaian staple – a type of flour made from cassava. 

She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her spouse to pay the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy cassava. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cassava.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, a 30-year-old married man with no children, has been buying, selling, and repairing shoes to make a living since 2006. Grateful to Faulu Kenya for giving him finances to inject into his business, Alex is requesting a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy leather, a sewing machine, and shoes.

In the next five years he wants to establish another shop so that he can advance his dream of opening multiple outlets in the country.

loans.use: to buy leather, a sewing machine, and shoes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a baker at Elmina, as shown in the picture above. She is single and has five children. She has been a baker for six years. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a hard-working 24-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with three children. One of her children is in school. She has been providing for her family for the last four years by running a retail shop. She supplements her income from the rent she gets from her rental houses. She wants, in the next five years, to have made her shop a one-stop shop for her customers. Her dream is to expand her business to a wholesale one. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and cooking fats. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for enabling her to add stock to her business by advancing her finances.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a single parent taking care of three children. She sells soap at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. As a single parent, the income she makes from the sale of soap is used to educate her children. Efua will use the loan to purchase more soap to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more soap to sell.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 28 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Рахим занимается торговлей на рынке "Саховат". У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает мужскую одежду и обувь. Этим видом деятельности Рахим занимается уже пять лет. Он берет кредит для покупки мужских рубашек и осеней обуви. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Rahim lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Rahim is involved in retail sales at the "Sahovat" market.  He has a retail outlet, where he sells men's clothing and shoes.  Rahim has been involved in this type of business for five years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase men's shirts and fall shoes.  He wants to increase his merchandise selection.

loans.use: to purchase men's shirts and fall shoes

loans.name: Cepha

texts.en:
A hardworking and committed businessman, Cepha is 49 years old, married, and blessed with four school-going children aged 18, 15, 10, and 3. For the last 15 years Cepha has been providing for his family by selling electronic goods, having previously worked as an employee.

Now requesting a loan of 80000 Kenya shillings to buy televisions and dvds, he is grateful to Faulu Kenya for advancing him finances to inject into his business. Cepha wants to own a big electronics shop within the next five years

loans.use: to buy televisions and dvds.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau, 39, is single. She lives with her parents in a small house located in Ho Chi Minh City. Chau supports her family through the income that she earns running a general store in front of her house. Chau sells a small range of products in her store.

Chau would like to receive a loan to expand her business by buying additional stock such as pens, notebooks, toilet paper, confectionery and snack foods to sell. She hopes that an expanded range of products will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract new customers.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and provide additional support to her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as stationery, confectionery and snack foods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 43 years old and married. She has 2 children. Her husband is a driver. She earns money by selling pork in a small market. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa intends to take a loan to purchase many kinds of pork to expand her business and to better meet the demands of her customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be abL. to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase many kinds of pork.

loans.name: Tukwatilewamu Group

texts.en:
Most people open ajar the doors of business with a set purpose of improving their less than satisfactory livelihoods. For 17 years, 39 year old Zaituni has been plying her restaurant business in Jinja. She has made significant strides in opening new and better horizons of opportunities for herself and her family. This, the divorced mother of 5 says, would not have been possible if she had not gone into business. She says that if she had not gone into business, she would probably be at a wits end, trying to bring value to her life and to that of her family. 

Under the auspices of close relatives and friends, Zaituni decided to start up this business. Because of what she had gone through, Zaituni believed only hard work, prayers and determination would see her bringing a new lease to her family's narrow circumstances. The restaurant business is quite lucrative, provided one has a steady supply of food. This supply of food can, in most cases, be easy if one owns a farm where they can get food to cook and sell. For Zaituni, the supply of food would, in most cases, be achieved through food purchases from the many food markets in Jinja. In the course of time, her working capital was rising. The rise was mostly down to that fact that her clientele was increasing. This meant she was able to consolidate her profits and also improve on the facilities, food and service delivery at her restaurant.

Zaituni had always thought she would not be able to take care of her beloved children without her erstwhile Husband. But here she was able to provide for her family and relatives without her man. 300,000 Ugandan shillings is what this business generates for her on a monthly basis as income. She is requesting for this Kiva loan to purchase more furniture, cutlery and foods for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture, cutlery and foods for her business.

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is 47 years old. He comes from village Shemokmedi, West Georgia. Josef lives with his wife Manana and their 7 year old son. The son goes to school.

The only source of income for the family is agriculture. In particular, the family has 5 milk cows. They sell milk and other dairy products at the local market. Also, they have 500 nut trees. Harvested nuts are sold to the wholesalers, seasonally. Josef also runs a bee-keeping business, which consists of 20 beehives. Total average monthly income of the family is 390 Laris (GEL-Georgian Lari).

Josef has requested credit for purchasing an additional 3-4 bee-hives and bee-colonies. Also, a small part of the credit will be used to purchase fertilizers for fertilizing the land in the nut-garden. As a result of these investments, the family will get more honey and increased harvest of nuts in the relevant seasons. These increases will positively influence the income of the family. Josef and Manana hope that the increase in income will allow them to renovate their house to make it more comfortable and quiet.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee-colonies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a hard-working, 42 year-old business lady. She is single and a proud mother of two school-going children. She has been selling fruits for the last 11 years to make ends meet. In the next five years, she wants to become a major supplier of fruits in the region. Her dream is to see her business grow and expand. Joyce wants a loan of 50000 Kenya shillings to buy bananas and avocados. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy bananas and avocados to sell

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and children. Lan's husband sells gas and gas containers to people in the local community. Lan supports her family by selling hot pork dishes from her food stall. She has done this for the past two years. Lan plans to take a loan to expand her business by buying bread, pork, and furniture for her stall so that she can better serve her existing customers and attract new ones. Lan hopes her business will run smoothly and she will be able to earn more money to cover her family's living expenses.

loans.use: to buy bread, pork, and furniture

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa is married and has four children. She sells maize in small and large quantities at Elmina, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a tailor. Abenawa uses her income to pay utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abenawa plans to save to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: Abenawa will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en: Nanuli comes from the village of Shroma, West Georgia. She is 53 years old and lives with her husband Mamia and her 30 year-old daughter. Nanuli runs the agricultural business of the family. The family has four milk cows. Nanuli produces and sells on average 70 kg cheese per month. She sells cheese at a local open market. Also the family owns 500 nut trees. Harvested nuts are sold locally as well. With the requested loan, Nanuli plans to diversify her business. In particular, she plans to purchase five bee-hives with bee-colonies. She will get approximately 40 liters of honey per year. Sale of honey will increase the family’s income. In the future Nanuli plans to reinvest the profit from bee-keeping and increase the number of bee-hives.

loans.use: to purchase five bee-hives with bee-colonies

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua cooks banku — a fermented corn and cassava based bread usually served with soup or stew — for sale at Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Ekua has been selling banku for 7 years. Her loan will be used to buy maize, fish, tomatoes and other foods to cook and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better eating place.

loans.use: to buy maize, fish, tomatoes and other ingredients to cook to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is 37 years old. He is a committed and hard-working business man. He is married and blessed with 4 children of whom two are in school. Victor has been running a retail shop for the last 13 years. He supplements his income from the salary he gets from his employment. Victor wants to own a large outlet store in the next five years. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fats, maize flour etc. His association with Faulu Kenya has enabled his business to improve and grow. It is his dream to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fats, maize flour etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man with two school-going children. He lives in a rented house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past 15 years, Daniel has operated a photography business, moving from door to door, looking for customers. Daniel's major challenge is the high cost of transportation while moving from one place to another. He dreams of expanding his photography business to cover a large area in the future. With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase a digital camera and a motorcycle to start another business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a digital camera and a motorcycle to start another business.

loans.name: Abana

texts.en: Abana is single and has six children. She sells cloth, materials, plastic containers, shoes, slippers and others at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She has done this for five years. The income she makes goes into feeding, clothing and educating the kids. Abana will use the loan to purchase more of the above-mentioned items to sell. Abana plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth, materials, plastic containers, shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is 32 years old and married with a 15-year-old child who is in school. She operates Winnie Spares where she sells vehicle spare parts.  She has been in the business for five years.  Previously, she was employed. Winnie works hard in her business in order to educate her child. Winnie hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future. She has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy filters and elements.

loans.use: To buy filters and elements

loans.name: Sop Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité du nom de Sop Naby du banc villageois de Ngadji existe depuis le 17 mai 2010.Il est composé de 08 femmes qui font du petit commerce et de l'embouche ovine.
Madame Ndagou, la responsable,est veuve et mère de 05 enfants.Sur la photo, elle est tout à fait à droite.
elle fait du petit commerce et de l'embouche ovine. 
Elle s'approvisionne en légumes et en ingrédient dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend dans le village.
Avec son prêt, elle voudrai acheter des sujets pour son élevage et des marchandises pour son commerce.
Avec les bénéfices, elle aide son fils pour les charges de la maison.
texts.en:
The Sop Naby solidarity group, which belongs to the Banc Villageois of Ngadji, was created on May 17, 2010. It consists of eight (8) women who conduct small trade and sheep fattening.

Mrs. Ndagou, the head of the group, is a widow with five children. She is at the far right in the photo. Her activities are small trade and sheep fattening. She buys vegetables and various ingredients at the weekly markets for resale in her village. 

With her loan, she wants to purchase sheep for fattening and merchandise to sell. She will use the revenue to help her son with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening, and merchandise for her small trade activity

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells cooked yam and gari at Elmina in the Central Region. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Rose has been selling yam for six years. She assists her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more yams to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more yams

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells cloths, plastic containers and bowls at Dompoase near Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. The business is three years old. She responsibly assists her husband to pay utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy additional plastic containers to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy additional plastic containers to sell.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité bokk jom est crée le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont du même village.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

La responsable Bousso est âgée de 63 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce , elle a une bonne expérience de plus 4 ans dans ce domaine. elle est debout sur la photo à droite emmitouflée d'un châle blanc.

Elle achète ses légumes dans la ville et vient revendre au village.

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce.

ses bénéfices lui permettent de réaliser une épargne consistante et de participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of twelve women from the same village. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Bousso, who is the group's official, is 63 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a small business and has over four years of good experience in this domain. She is the one standing at the right in the photo and wrapped snug in a white shawl. She purchases her vegetables in the city and resells them in the village. Her loan will enable her to bolster her business. Her profits will allow her to save a substantial amount of money and to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to be sold

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a boutique business selling handbags and shoes. She faces the major challenges of seasonality, especially during the rainy season, and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of establishing a beauty salon in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of handbags and shoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of hand bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anaw Bouyeguete Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 04 juin 2010. Le groupe est  composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mariéme qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants.

Elle s’active dans la vente d'habits artisanal. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle mène depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront de participer à l’amélioration les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 4, 2010. The group is composed of fifteen women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Mariéme, who is at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's official. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is active in selling artisanal clothing. She has good experience in this business domain for having worked in it for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will enable her to help improve her family’s living conditions (healthcare, food, clothing, etc....)

loans.use: to buy artisanal clothing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with two children who have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a green grocery business, selling in a shop and from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. During the rainy season, availability of vegetables is lower in supply and demand is higher. She dreams of establishing a wholesale business selling potatoes in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of mangoes, tomatoes, dried fish and coconut to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of mangoes, tomatoes, dried fish and coconut .

loans.name: Hafcatou

texts.fr: Mère d’un enfant, Hafcatou est revendeuse de tissus depuis 2003. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et vend à toutes personnes. Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra  d’acheter 02 rouleaux de tissus chemise et 01 bal de tissu pantalon. Son conjoint est commerçant.
texts.en:
Hafcatou is a mother to one child, and her spouse is a merchant. She has been selling fabrics since 2003. She buys her merchandise at the Grand Market of Lomé and sells to all types of customers. 

The loan she is seeking will help her to buy two bolts of shirt fabric and one bale of pant fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for shirts and pants

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells a variety of items like maize, shea butter, polythene bags and other items at Elmina. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for seven years. She supports her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to purchase the above items for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase maize, shea butter, polythene bags and other items to sell

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Babacar du banc villageois de Ngadji est créé depuis le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui s'activent dans le petit commerce de haricots, dans la transformation d'huile et de l'embouche ovine.
La responsable, Awa, âgée de 51 ans, est veuve et mère de 07 enfants. Sur la photo elle est tout à fait à droite habillée en jaune.
Elle fait de l'embouche et du petit commerce. Elle confectionne des petits pagnes et de l'encens. Elle vend aussi du poisson sec. Elle a de l’expérience dans ces domaines.
Elle voudrai acheter des sujets et des marchandises avec son prêt.
Avec ses bénéfices elle gère sa famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Babacar of the Banc Villageois of Ngadji was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of eight women who are active in small businesses involving beans, the processing of oil, and the fattening of sheep. 

Awa, who is the group's official, is 51 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. In the photo, she is the one at the far right and dressed in yellow. She raises livestock and works in small-scale commerce. She also sells dried fish and incense. She has experience in these domains. 

With her loan, she would like to buy animals and some merchandise. With her profits, she manages her family.

loans.use: to buy animals for raising and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Djikane Madiake Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 04 juin 2010. Le groupe est  composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants.

Elle s’active dans la vente de repas(petit déjeuner, déjeuner et diner). Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis très longtemps.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 4, 2010. The group is composed of fifteen women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Fatou, who is at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's official. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She is active in selling meals (breakfast, lunch, and dinner). She has good experience in this business for having worked at it for a long time. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will allow her to improve her family’s situation (schooling, etc....)

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad comes from the village of Kobuleti, seaside of Georgia. He is 30 years old, married and lives with his big family: his wife Natia, two sons (5 and 1 year old) and his parents. 

The family earns a living with a family agricultural business. In particular, they own 4,000 sq. meters of citrus garden and 7,000 sq. meters of maize cornfield. Zviad became involved in the family business seven years ago. Harvested corn and citruses are sold locally to the retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

With the requested credit, Zviad plans to purchase fertilizers for the citrus garden and cornfield. After fertilizing, the family will get more and better quality corn and citrus. The family will sell more products for a higher price, which will cause significant increase in the family’s income. 

Zviad plans to use the increase in profit for renovation of the house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells banku (made from corn) at Elmina. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a carpenter. Adjoa has been selling banku for 10 years. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to cook

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, a 49-year-old man, sells cooking gas to earn a living. He started the business six years ago and has employed two people. He also does farming at his rural home so as to earn extra income. Robert works hard so as to provide for his wife and three children. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has witnessed a lot of growth in his business because he has managed to add to his business' stock. He hopes to grow his business and become financially stable in the future. He needs a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy gas cylinders.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: In the picture above, Ekua sells maize, rice, loaves of bread, and oil (in the yellow gallon container) at Elmina. She is a single parent currently taking care of five children. Her business has been in existence for five years. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice, oil, and other items to resell. Her plan for her business is to build a better shop for it.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, oil, and other items to resell.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Evangelista is an ambitious 37-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two children aged three and one. 

She has been operating a beauty salon since 2007 to meet the needs of her family. She wants in the next five years to have her own premises to do her business. Her dream is to expand her business and take it to greater heights. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate her premises and to buy equipment and hair products. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has now become good at saving.

loans.use: to renovate her premises and to buy equipment and hair products

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has five children. She has been a baker at Elmina for 10 years. She also sells maize. Her husband is a driver. 

Ama wants to grow her maize business and so needs a loan of 400 Ghana Cedi (GHS) to buy two sacks of maize to sell. Ama plans to invest the new profits from her expanded business back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of maize to sell.

loans.name: Nimosi

texts.en:
Nimosi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate her business. She dreams of purchasing another motorcycle in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) she wants to purchase motorcycle spare parts, spokes, and tires. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts, spokes, and tires.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
In the picture above, Atta has some fried donuts which she sells in the community of Dompoase near Elmina in Cape Coast. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher. 

Atta has been selling donuts for nine years. She assists her husband in providing for the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, and other ingredients to fry donuts for sale. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, and other ingredients to fry donuts for sale.

loans.name: Sope Dabakh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Dabakh du banc villageois de Ngadji est créé depuis le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui font de l'embouche ovine et du petit commerce. Elles sont amies et parentes.
La responsable Anta, âgée de 49 ans, est mariée et mère de 08 enfants et a 03 autres à sa charge. Sur la photo elle est à droite et est habillée en boubou rose.
Elle fait du commerce et de l'embouche ovine. Elle vend des légumes et des denrées de première nécessite dans le village.
Elle voudrai, avec son prêt, acheter des sujets pour son élevage  et des marchandises pour son commerce.
Elle aide son mari pour les charges de la maison.
texts.en: The solidarity group Sop Dabakh of the Banc Villageois of Ngadji was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of 14 women who fatten sheep and who have small businesses. The women are friends or are related. Anta is the group's official. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of eight children. And she has three others to support. In the photo, she is the one at the right dressed in a pink boubou. She does commerce in the fattening of sheep. She sells vegetables and basic provisions in the village. Anta would like to use her loan to buy animals to raise and some merchandise for commerce. She helps out her husband in covering household expenses.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Caurie Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 18 mai 2007. Il est  composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mama qui est assise  à la droite de la photo sur la chaise verte est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons frais. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité, nourriture, etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 18, 2007. It is composed of fifteen women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Mama, who is seated in a green chair at the right in the photo, is the group's official. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She also supports four other children who are entrusted to her by her parents. She is active in selling fresh fish and has good experience in this business domain for having worked in it for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will allow her to improve her family’s situation (schooling, food, etc.)

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Dimbalante Group

texts.fr:
Le Dimbalante est crée le 17 mai 2010 et regroupe 13 femmes qui sont toutes du même village; leurs activités sont le petit commerce et l'embouche
Mime est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 49 ans et mariée mère de 6 enfants debout sur la photo couverte d'un châle vert. elle achète des légumes en ville et revend dans son village, elle fait aussi de l'embouche bovine.Elle fait ces activités depuis 10 ans.
texts.en: Dimbalante was set up on 17th May 2010 and is a grouping of 13 women who are all from the same village; they have small trading businesses and fatten up animals. Mime is in charge of the group and is 49 years old. She is married and mother to six children and she is standing up in the photo and wearing a green shawl. She buys vegetables and resells them in her village; she also has a beef fattening activity. She has been carrying out these activities for the past ten years.

loans.use: to buy and resell vegetables for consumption

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has operated a food stall business for five years, cooking beans and chipati (flat bread). Her primary business challenge is the high costs of transportation. Her major dream for the future is to establish a restaurant business.

With her Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Halima is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and maize flour

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, age 44, earns a living by rearing poultry. She has been in this business for seven years and has employed one person. She sells chickens to hotels for slaughter. She is married  and her three children are enrolled in school.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business through training in business management skills. She hopes to own a big poultry farm in the future.  

She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy broilers and chicken feed and to vaccinate her chickens.

loans.use: to buy broilers and chicken feed and to vaccinate her chickens

loans.name: Diappo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Diappo du banc villageois de Ngadji existe depuis le 17 mai 2010,il est composé de 16 femmes qui habitent le même village et qui ont comme dénominateur commun le petit commerce.
La responsable madame Coumba est âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants, est à droite de la photo en châle rose.
Elle fait du commerce de fruits et légumes et a une bonne expérience dans ce secteur. Elle dispose d'une boutique dans le village.
Elle voudrai avec son prêt agrandir son secteur d'activité.
Ses bénéfices lui permettent de développer et de diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
The Diappo solidarity group belonging to the Banc Villageois in Ngadji was created on 17th May 2010 and is made up of 16 women who live in the same village, their common denominator being small trading activities.

The person in charge of the group is Coumba, who is 44 years old, married and mother to six children. She is on the right of the photo covered in a pink shawl. She buys and sells fruit and vegetables and has good experience in this domain She has a shop in the village. With her loan she would like to expand her field of activity. Her profits will enable her to develop and diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for reselling

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells maize at the Elmina market for a living. She has been selling maize for eight years. She pays the family's utility bills, school fees for her four children, and accommodation costs with the income she makes from her business. 

Ekua's loan will be used to buy more sacks of maize. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of maize to offer for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business, her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Her greatest challenge is seasonality, especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase spare motorcycle spokes, tires and rims and to pay transport charges. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer services.

loans.use: To purchase spare motorcycle spokes, tires and rims and to pay transport charges.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is single and has six children. She sells maize and corn dough at Elmina, which she has done for seven years. Corn dough is mostly used in the preparation of banku. She sees to the well-being of her home. Aba will use the loan to purchase sacks of maize to make more corn dough for sale. Aba plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize to make more corn dough to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

Jennifer has operated a clothes-selling business for the past four years, selling at retail, at wholesale, at the market and from door to door to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces the major challenges of theft and the high costs of seasonality in her business. 

With the KSHS 60,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and handbags for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and handbags to sell

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия проживает в районе Фархор. Она вдова. У неё четверо детей. Она имеет среднее техническое образование. Более десяти лет Робия шьёт свадебные платья и сдает на прокат. Кредит берет для покупки швейной машины.
texts.en: Robiya lives in the Farkhor district.  She is a widow and has four children.  She has a secondary technical education.  Robiya has been sewing and renting out wedding dresses for over ten years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse, age 40, is a Rwandan entrepreneur who started a small business some time ago and now it has grown into a general store. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more items to offer for sale in his shop so he can meet the growing demand of his business. This loan will allow him to buy additional rice, cooking oil, matches, salt, sugar, and tomatoes to sell to his customers.

With the profits from this business, Alphonse hopes to renovate his house and to accumulate savings for himself and his family. He is divorced and has three children between the ages of 20 and 24. His ex-wife is unemployed.

loans.use: to buy such items as rice, cooking oil, matches, salt, sugar, and tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Kyajura Tweyambe Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Francis is the leader of the Kyajura Twekambe group in Kihihi. He is a very hard-working man who takes no chances when it comes to ensuring the prosperity of his business. He is a trader at market, dealing mostly in cereals and other produce. He has been engaged in his business for four years. His endeavor is located by the roadside where he is able to attract a good number of customers, particularly those from the local community. 

Francis is also involved in tea harvesting as his other business, and this supplements his monthly income. Francis says that previous loans have enabled him to have enough stock for his customers as well as to ensure that he saves on the transport costs of buying in small quantities. The tea leaves he sells are always fresh from his tea plantation and he has a dream of expanding his business further. 

He is reaquesting a loan to be able to buy more cereals for resale.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to offer for sale

loans.name: Loveness Group

texts.en:
Benedict is a member of the loan group "Loveness," which has a total of 20 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. Benedict is in his late forties. He and his wife have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. 

Benedict has been selling meat since 2006. He works from 7 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He plans to use it to buy more meat to offer for sale. His dream is one day to be able to build a house to offer for rent.

loans.use: to buy more meat to offer for sale

loans.name: Takku Ligguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est crée le 17 mai 2010 et regroupe 12 femmes du même village.
Thiané est la responsable du groupe et âgée de 44 ans, mariée mère de 4enfants. 
Elle est commerçante de légumes qu'elle achète dans les villes et vient revendre dans son village.Elle mène cette activité depuis 4 ans
texts.en: The group was set up on 17th May 2010 and is made up of 12 women from the same village. Thiané is in charge of the group and is 44 years old, married and mother to four children. She trades in vegetables which she buys in the towns and then sells in her village. She has been carrying out this activity for the past four years.

loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables for consumption

loans.name: Mensiwah

texts.en:
Mensiwah is a widow with five dependents. For ten years she has been a fish monger in Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She uses the income from her sales to educate, feed and clothe her dependents.

Mensiwah’s loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell. She anticipates reinvesting her new earnings.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Bessik

texts.en:
Bessik lives in the village of Tskhratskaro in the Imereti region of Georgia. He is 37 years old, married and lives with his wife, Ekaterine, twelve-year-old son, ten-year-old daughter and his retired parents. His children go to school.

Bessik is a fireman. His job takes a lot of time and energy, but he still finds time for the family’s business. Bessik’s family has two cows, the milk from which they produce cheese and sell locally. They also have one hundred nut trees, the nuts from which they sell locally as well. The total average income of the family is 400 GEL a month.

As their existing income isn’t enough for the family, and their living conditions are poor, Bessik decided to work as a taxi driver using his own car when he has free time. With the requested loan Bessik plans to purchase a car. According to his estimations he will get approximately 150 GEL in additional income a month.

The increase in the family’s income will allow them to increase their spending and so improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car for use as a taxi.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is forty years old, married and has two children. For five years he has been operating a cafe to earn a living. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. He also has a transport business and sells firewood for extra income.

John was able to start his transport business after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya. He has now requested a loan of 70,000 KES to buy ingredients such as maize flour, cooking fat, baking flour, sugar, maize and beans for his cafe. He hopes to open another outlet in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for his cafe.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa has worked as a fishmonger for 12 years and is shown here with some smoked fish she has prepared for sale. She is divorced and has seven dependents. With the assistance of her ex-husband's family, she takes care of the family and the home. 

This loan will serve as an additional source of income that will allow Theresa to acquire more fresh fish to smoke and offer for sale. Her future plan for her business is to buy a plot of land and to reinvest in her business for further growth.

loans.use: to acquire more fresh fish to smoke and offer for sale

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa operates a grocery store where she sells such items as rice, canned fish and tomatoes, and powdered milk. She is shown here standing in front of her provision shop. She and her husband, who is a farmer, have two children. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase additional canned fish and tomatoes, rice, and other items to offer for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned fish and tomatoes, rice, and other items to offer for sale

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée , mère de deux filles qui étudient au Lycée.Leur père étant en retraite, c'est elle qui supporte leurs frais de scolarité, de santé et d'habillement. Elle exerce dans le commerce de produits vestimentaires et en même temps, dispose de chaises, de bâches et de matelas qu'elle loue à l’occasion des manifestations familiales et sociales.Elle est sociétaire de l'IMCEC depuis trois ans mais n'y a jamais pris de crédits. Elle sollicite aujourd'hui un crédit de 300 000 FCFA  pour acquérir 02 balles de draps couvre- lit grand modèle qu'elle revendra au niveau des familles lors des fêtes de korité et Tabaski dans deux mois.Les bénéfices tirés de cette vente lui permettront de s'occuper des besoins de ses filles qui envisagent de faire une formation professionnelle en gestion pour l'une et en technologie pour l'autre. L'emprunteuse ambitionne dans le futur d'acheter de grandes tentes, d'augmenter son stock de chaises, d'acheter une tribune et un véhicule de transport pour satisfaire la forte demande notamment pendant les grandes manifestations religieuses.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman, who is mother to two girls who are studying at the Lycée (high school). Since their father is retired, it is she who pays for their education, health and clothing. She has a trading business selling clothing, and at the same time has chairs, canvas covers and mattresses which she rents out for family events and social occasions. She has been a member of IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual loan and savings institutions) for the past three years but has never taken out a loan. Today she is requesting a loan of 300,000FCFA in order to buy two bales of large bed covers which she will sell to families on the occasion of the Korité and Tabaski festivals in two months' time. The profits from these sales will allow her to provide for her daughters' needs; one of them is planning to undertake a professional training course in management and the other in technology. The borrower's ambition for the future is to buy large tents and increase her stock of chairs, to buy a stand and a vehicle in order to satisfy strong demand particularly during large religious events.

loans.use: to buy two bales of large bedcovers

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa operates a food stall at the market at Elmina in the central region of Ghana. In the picture, she is shown pounding fufu to be made ready for sale. She is a widow taking care of seven dependents. 

Her loan will be used to purchase more food items to cook and offer for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook and offer for sale

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Hyline is a hardworking 28-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children who go to school. For the last four years she has been selling secondhand household goods to help pay for her family’s needs.

Hyline is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy gas cylinders, carpets and DVDs. In the next five years she wants to have opened up another stall. She has a dream that her business will grow and expand to give her ample capital.

Hyline is grateful to Faulu Kenya for advancing her a loan to use to add stock to her stall.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders, carpets and DVDs to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is married and lives with her two children and husband, who is a trader. As part of her wifely duties she assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

Maame sells salted fish at Eyeikrom near Elmina. Her loan will be used to buy more salted fish to sell. She hopes to use the increase in profits from her business to build a shop where she can sell different varieties of fish.

loans.use: to buy more salted fish to sell.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима проживает в городе Куляб. Она замужем. У неё пятеро детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Уже как 15 лет Рахима шьёт женские национальные платья. Она берет заказы у себя дома. Целью получения кредита является покупка материалов. Она хочет сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Rahima lives in the city of Kulob.  She is married and has five children.  She has a secondary education.  Rahima has been sewing women's national dresses for 15 years.  She fulfills her orders at home.  The goal of obtaining this loan is a purchase of materials.  Rahima wants to sew dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for sewing

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa is a single mother of two children. She sells aluminum basins in Elmina by moving around the area.

Abenawa wants to increase the quantity of basins she sells and so needs a loan to buy more basins. With her increase in profits, Abenawa plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more basins to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Efua assists her husband with the income she makes to feed the whole family.

For the past eight years Efua has sold palm oil in both small and large quantities in Elmina. She will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit to process into oil for resale. With the new profits she anticipates, Efua plans to provide the best of educations for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to process into oil for resale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is divorced and has five dependents. For the past twenty years she has sold Fante kenkey (a type of kenkey associated with the Fante people) at Elmina; the picture shows her in the process of making Fante kenkey.

Abena will use her loan to buy more maize flour to prepare kenkey for sale. She plans to plow her extra profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour to prepare kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Mzimuni Group

texts.en:
Zaina, who is in her early twenties, is single. She has been running a cosmetics business for one year now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Zaina’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. As leader of the loan group "Mzimuni," she will share this loan with fifteen other members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Zaina wants to use her portion of the loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. Her dream is to one day open another cosmetics shop.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: A divorced mother taking care of four children has not been easy for Esi, who is shown in the photo displaying the palm kernels she uses to make oil. She now wants to increase the quantity of oil she makes through a Kiva loan to purchase large quantities of palm kernels to process. Esi plans to reinvest the profit for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of palm kernels to process into oil for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice, a 34-year-old single mother of four children ranging in age from 4 to14 years, lives in Hioma, Uganda where, for the last five years, she has been operating a textile business that she started with 500,000/= but now has inventory worth two million. Beatrice faces the challenge both of rain and too much sunshine but hopes to move into a sheltered premise and set up a boutique. She is now requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is 44 years old and married, with 4 children aged 12 to 24 years old. She also looks after her grandmother. Hadijah lives in a permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. Her dream is to educate her children up to university.

For four years, Hadijah has been dealing in the textile business. She started out with 200,000 UGX but has so far accumulated stock of 200,0000 UGX. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs and sometimes the vehicle breaks down. Her dream is to set up a boutique instead of being a market vendor. Hadijah needs this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 36 years old. He comes from the village of Sareki in the Sachkhere District of West Georgia. Giorgi lives with his wife, Lia, two daughters (7 and 8 years old) and his parents, who are retired. Both children go to school. 

Giorgi works as stage director in the Sachkhere Theater. He likes his job and is happy with it. Her wife works as a leader of an orchestra in the same theater. However, the salaries they earn aren’t enough for the family; therefore, Giorgi also works as an operator in a local petrol station. The total average income of the family, including Giorgi’s parents’ pensions, is 900 GEL. 

Giorgi has requested credit in order to start up a bee keeping business. He has experience in this business, as the family used to run one years ago. Giorgi will purchase 10 beehives and get approximately 100 liters of honey per year, which will be sold locally to the villagers. Giorgi’s parents will be actively involved in the business. Giorgi is sure that his business will be successful and he will be able to expand it soon.

loans.use: to purchase 10 beehives and bee colonies

loans.name: Dovya Group

texts.en:
Happy, who is in her late 20s, is single with two children who go to school. She has had a food vending business for one year. She works from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy secondhand clothes and take them upcountry (to the Tanga region) to sell them there. Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

Happy will share this loan with her group "Dovya" which consists of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes and take them upcountry to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old and married, with 2 children, 8 months and 3 years old. He has no other dependents. He and his family live in a mud wattle house in Kibaale, Uganda.

Emmanuel has been selling cereals for four years and has been able to use the business proceeds to buy a motorcycle for a transport business. Emmanuel faces a challenge of price fluctuations for produce. His dream is to buy a motorcycle and set up a food store. He intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old. He is a hardworking and entrepreneurial businessman. Peter is married and blessed with a 3-year-old school-going child. For the last six years, he has been doing printing work to provide for his family. Peter wants to have a big printing firm in the next 5 years. His dream is to build a home for his family.

Peter is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy stationery and printing materials. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for the loan it advanced him that went a long way to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy stationery and printing materials

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 25 years old, married and with one child aged two years old. He lives in Karuguuza, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests on him.

For three years Gerald has been selling local gin, and with his profits he has been able to buy three pieces of land. Gerald faces the challenge of high inflation but hopes to begin ferrying local gin to bigger markets. He needs a loan to buy jerry cans of local gin to sell.

Gerald’s dream is to set up a sustainable income-generating business for his family.

loans.use: to buy jerry cans of local gin to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees for her child.

For the past three years, Martha has operated a retail shop, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is theft because of security risks in her area.

Martha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With her 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bags of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Aged 31 years, Vincent hails from Kyenjojo District, is married and the father of four children aged between fourteen and four years. The family lives in a semi-permanent house. 
Vincent has run a retail shop  for five years. He acquired his initial capital to set up shop from farming. He is requesting a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell in his shop. 
In the future Vincent dreams of having a wholesale shop and giving his children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For three years, Mercy has operated a beauty salon. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mercy dreams of establishing a well-furnished beauty salon business in the future. Mercy plans to use this 40,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of cosmetics and hair weaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cosmetics and hair weaves.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 45-year-old married man with six children, all living in a residential permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Charged with the responsibility of looking after the family, Christopher's major dream is to get a business that can sustain his family. He is a company accountant and a farmer, which has facilitated him in providing for the family. He has a challenge of limited land to farm on and his desire is to own at least 20 acres of land. Christopher needs this loan to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her real estate houses and to purchase cement, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is 46 year-old Elizabeth. She is married and has 4 children aged 19, 16, 13 and 10. She has 5 additional dependents, her nephews and nieces, who live with her.

In 2008, Elizabeth established her sewing materials and drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in providing for their household, and this business is her major source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Elizabeth earns about SLL 900,000 every month from her business.

Elizabeth would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy siphon materials, poplin, checked material, shine-shine lace, wool thread and soft drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 250,000. In the future, Elizabeth plans to transform her business into a provisions shop and to complete construction of her house. The rising costs of her goods and of transportation are Elizabeth's major business challenges. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials and drinks

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando desde sus 16 años aprendió la labor de latonería y pintura gracias a las enseñanzas de su tío.

El actualmente tiene su propio negocio que es el que le permite tener su sustento diario y el de su hijo, el tiene una buena clientela y es reconocido por su buen servicio y trabajo. Luis Fernando quiere que su negocio cada día crezca mas y sea reconocido y para esto el quiere comprar materia prima que le pueda facilita su trabajo y así ofrecerle a sus clientes un mejor del servicio, además así mejora su calidad de vida ya que se incrementan sus ventas.
texts.en: At the age of 16, Luis Fernando learned how to perform auto paint and body work from his uncle.  He currently has his own business, which allows him to provide for his daily needs and those of his son.  Luis Fernando has a good customer base and is recognized for his good service and quality work.  He wants his business to grow more each day and gain more recognition.  For this reason, he wants to buy more supplies that he needs to facilitate his work.  As a result, he will be able to offer better service to his customers, improve his quality of life, and increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for performing paint and body work.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 35-year-old married man with four children. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Paul has the responsibility of looking after the family and his dream is to educate his children. He deals in the harvest of grasshoppers and rides a motorcycle for a living, which has enabled him to provide for the children.

Paul has a challenge of limited equipment during the harvest season. His desire is to ably maximize the harvest of grasshoppers as they have a ready market. Paul needs this loan to buy grasshoppers to sell.

loans.use: To buy drums from which grasshoppers are harvested

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

For the past seven years, Teresia has operated a green grocery business, selling in a shop at wholesale and at the market. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. Teresia dreams of establishing a wholesale grocery in the future.

Teresia plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase a dairy cow to start a dairy farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a dairy farming business.

loans.name: Carlos Plutarco

texts.es:
Carlos Plutarco tiene 32 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con dos hijos de 8 y 3 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agriculas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios para cultivar mas.

Le gusta compartir todo con la familia porque son muy unidos.
texts.en:
Carlos Plutarco is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children (ages 8 and 3) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Tierra Nuestra” (Our Land) meet in the neighborhood of San Luis de Zapotal, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Carlos is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his products at the AGRIPAC commercial center and sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan he is requesting will be used for planting corn and rice. He plans to buy seeds and compost for his corn and rice crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his crops and the lack of money to pay for more workers. His dream is to have his own land so that he can cultivate more crops.

Carlos enjoys sharing with his entire family because they are very close.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost for planting corn and rice.

loans.name: Kereb

texts.en:
Kereb is a 36-year-old married man with two children. He lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Kereb's dream is to educate his children and to buy land for farming.

Kereb has been selling agro veterinary products for 10 years. His major challenge is lack of enough capital to meet the demands of his customers. Kereb needs this loan to buy agro veterinary supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy agro veterinary supplies to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo Javier

texts.es:
Alfredo Javier tiene 41 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 14, 6 años y 9 meses, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es mejorar la casa y dar el estudio a los hijos.


Le gusta jugar futbol y pasar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Alfredo Javier is 41 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children (ages 14, 6, and 9 months) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Tierra Nuestra” (Our Land) meet in the neighborhood of San Luis de Zapotal, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Alfredo is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his products at the AGRIPAC commercial center and sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan he is requesting will be used for planting corn and rice. He plans to buy seeds and compost for his corn and rice crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his crops and the lack of money to pay for more workers. His dreams include making improvements to his house and providing for his children’s education.

Alfredo enjoys playing soccer and spending time with his children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost for planting corn and rice.
