Es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar una mototaxi de segunda, que le permitirá iniciarse en este nuevo servicio de transporte público y también utilizarla para transportar su mercadería.

Josefina es una mujer trabajadora conocida por nuestra entidad y goza de un buen récord de pagos. Este crédito le permitirá seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de sus hijos poco a poco.
texts.en:
Josefina is a 41 year-old woman.  She is a single mother and lives with her two children in Lambayeque district.  She lives in a small community of entrepreneurial and hard-working people.

Josefina has been selling fresh fish for five years.  She makes her sales in an itinerant manner (using a motorcycle taxi) or from a small stall located in her own home.  Josefina has an established customer base who feel happy with her products and the service she provides.

Josefina has a great desire to do well and she would like to invest in a second business.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a used motorcycle taxi which would allow her to start out in a new business, providing a public transport service.  She would also use it for transporting her merchandise.

Josefina is a hard-working woman who is already known to our institution.  She has a good payment record.  This loan would allow her to continue gradually improving her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
Steve started his Trophy Club, Texas-based social marketing company, " Impresa Social Marketing", because he saw that many businesses in his small town lacked a strong presence on social media communities, and he realized that this was due to the amount of time required to properly manage a social media presence. He says, “It costs absolutely nothing to get onto Facebook or LinkedIn, but the big price is time, and time, literally, is money when you’re running a business.” Steve aims to take out this problem of time by managing his clients’ social media presence, allowing them to focus solely on running their businesses.

Impresa Social Marketing, which will begin accepting clients on August 1st, will use Steve’s marketing experience to create compelling and regularly-updated business profiles on social media venues like Facebook and LinkedIn. Before starting his business, Steve worked in events marketing, where he learned that social media management was an increasingly important part of his job. This experience serves as the underpinning for Steve’s business practices at Impresa. 

To ensure the effectiveness of his approach to social media management, Steve is now managing three companies promotionally. He says, “We have about a dozen businesses waiting for us to roll out the business, but I don’t want to start until I have all of my ducks in a row.” The promotional clients serve as both a tool for Steve to perfect his practice and as a way to advertise his services to potential clients. 

One of the most difficult parts of beginning Impresa has been emphasizing the importance of a regularly updated and constantly changing social media presence to his clients. “I would get a lot of people saying, ‘Well, my nephew made my Facebook page already.’ The problem with this is that social media is organic; it needs to be constantly changing in order to keep the interest of potential customers.” Though this was a problem initially, the success of Steve’s promotional clients has been enough to illustrate the importance of the type of social media presence that his business aims to create.

This loan has allowed Steve to lay the groundwork for his upcoming grand opening. With it, he purchased computer equipment, such as a PC pad, and software called Market Me, which will allow him to manage all of his clients’ pages at one time. This will allow him to take on a large number of clients without worrying about wasting time toggling between several screens.

Steve says one of his business’ biggest assets is that it is “in your area.” Working directly with clients by going to their places of business to take pictures and interact with the business owners is extremely important to the success of his business. In the future, he hopes to expand by placing account managers in other areas – this will allow him to continue to offer the one-on-one service valued by his customers while extending his business’ reach beyond its current borders of his small town.

You can visit Impresa Social Marketing’s website at www.impresasocialmarketing.com.

loans.use: to pay for computer equipment, a PC pad and Market Me software.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Ollantaytambo, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 49 años; la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, los hijos de la socia son todos independientes, La socia se dedica a la atención de sus restaurante la socia tiene un restaurante en el poblado de Ollantaytambo, este pueblo es muy bonito y lleno de cultura, a este poblado llegan todos los días muchos turistas, los cuales hacen una parada para apreciar todo el paisaje natural y el complejo de Ollantaytambo, este pueblo es considerado por muchos un pueblo museo porque en las mismas casas inkas viven los lugareños y conservan mucho de la tradición inka. La socia muy orgullosa de su origen ha puesto hace 4 años atrás un restaurante el cual lo administra personalmente y atiende a todos sus comensales, la socia se encarga de casi todo con la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de productos de primera necesidad los cuales ella usa a diario como son arroz, aceite, papas, carne y los comprara al por mayor en sacos y le será más rentable de este modo ella economizara.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to La Amistad de Ollantaytambo Community Bank located in Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. She is 49 years old, married, and has three children, all of them independent. 

She runs a restaurant in the town of Ollantaytambo. It’s a lovely town, full of culture, and many tourists visit there daily. They come to enjoy the beautiful scenery and the nearby ruins. The town is considered by many to be a museum because local people live in the very same houses once inhabited by Incas, and they keep many of the same traditions. This woman is very proud of her origins.

She opened her restaurant four years ago and administers it herself as well as personally looking after her customers. She takes charge of almost everything with help from her children and husband.

She would now like to borrow money to buy supplies in daily use such as rice, oil, potatoes, and meat in quantity and at wholesale prices. The savings will make her restaurant more profitable. She is very satisfied and grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, oil, potatoes, and meat for her restaurant

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Twenty-eight-year old Mary sells mobile phones and also offers mobile-phone money deposit and withdrawal services. She has been involved in this business for the past three years now in Mukono in Central Uganda. The happily married young mother of two says she began this business with help from her husband. She was at first an employee of one of the country's biggest telecommunications companies. She resigned and later began her own business. Per month, she says this business generates sales profits totaling 900,000 Ugandan shillings. With this Kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more mobile phones to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA AMISTAD D. OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Ollantaytambo, Provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 56 años; la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, los hijos D. la socia son todos independientes, La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un puesto D. venta D. frutas al por menor, lo que quiere decir que la socia venD. por unidades todos tipo D. frutas como, plátanos, manzanas, mandarinas, duraznos, uvas y todas las frutas D. la estación; La socia desea poder invertir el crédito en la compra D. frutas por cajas para la venta, la socia desea el crédito para comprar por cajas plátanos, uvas, manzanas, papaya. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio D. compra y venta D. frutas al por mayor y menor.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LA AMISTAD D. OLLANTAYTAMBO" which is in the district of Ollantaytambo, in Urubamba Province, department of Cusco.

She is 56, married and has five children, who are all independent.  She has a retail business and sells from her stand all types of fruit such as bananas, apples, tangerines, peaches, grapes and seasonal fruit.  She wants to use the loan to buy crates of bananas, grapes, apples and papaya wholesale.

She is very content and grateful for the support she is receiving and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy fruit wholesale for retail sales.

loans.name: Lucio Felix

texts.es:
Lucio es un hombre trabajador de 39 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos y una esposa, con los que vive en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. La comunidad donde Lucio vive no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, solo tiene luz eléctrica.

Luis se dedica a brindar el servicio de mototaxi. Este es un servicio de transporte público, que recorre distancias cortas llevando pasajeros en una moto que cuenta con una cabina en la parte trasera para ello. Además, Luis obtiene ingresos adicionales por la crianza de aves de corral y la producción de mango con la que cuenta actualmente.

Luis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, para el mantenimiento de su moto y  la compra de fertilizante para su cosecha de mango.
 
Luis cuenta con un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Lucio is a hard-working 39 year-old man.  He has a wife and three children with whom he lives in the rural part of Tambogrande-Piura district.  The community where Lucio lives does not have basic services.  It only has electricity.

Lucio provides a motorcycle taxi service.  This is a public transport service which consists of traveling short distances, carrying passengers on a motorcycle with a cabin in back.  Lucio also makes additional income raising poultry and growing mango.

Lucio is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi.  He will also buy fertilizers for his mango crop.

Lucio has a good credit record.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is a 23-year-old who lives in Pimampiro, Ecuador. He lives in a domestic partnership and has two children, aged 3 and 1. Franklin is a hardworking and responsible man of strong character. 

On his mother’s land, Frankin raises cattle and cultivates potatoes. Meanwhile, he also works in construction in the city of Pimampiro. Since he was very young, he has dedicated himself to his cattle, agriculture and construction work. He works alongside his common-law wife in caring for the cattle. 

Franklin is seeking this loan to purchase a young bull, potato seeds and tools. He has been working with FODEMI for three years and reports that his life has changed a lot because he was able to increase his ability to purchase cattle and make returns on his investments. In the future, Franklin’s goals are to fix up his house and continue to increase his herd of cattle. 

The photo shows Franklin on his day job working in construction. He works many jobs and has many responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy a young bull, potato seeds and tools for construction.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
El señor Eugenio tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado desde hace tiempo con la señora Rosalina de 53 años de edad, con la cual tiene dos hijos en edad escolar que dependen económicamente de ellos. Viven en su propia casa que está situada en Ciudad de Encarnacion.
El señor Eugenio es panadero, junto con su esposa poseen una Panadería desde hace tiempo en su domicilio,. Ellos producen diariamente galleta y coquito y distribuyen en el barrio y también en otros barrios de la ciudad, además de vender desde su casa. El señor Eugenio posee su moto en el cual se moviliza para hacer sus repartos. Gracias a esta actividad ellos han podido salir adelante, educar a sus hijos y solventar cualquier gasto que se les presente.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de otro horno que les resulta necesario para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 43 years old and has been married to 53 year-old Rosalina for some time.  The couple have two school-age children who are financially dependent on them.  They live in their own home which is located in the city of Encarnación.

Eugenio is a baker and he and his wife have owned a bakery in their home for some time.  They produce cookies and 'coquitos' (coconut cakes).  They distribute their products in their neighborhood and also in other neighborhoods in the city.  They also sell from their home.  Eugenio has a motorbike which he uses to make his deliveries.  Thanks to this business, they have been able to get ahead in life, educate their children and cover any expense that should present itself.

Eugenio is requesting this loan to buy another oven which he needs in order to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy an oven to expand his bakery

loans.name: Mercy Marlene

texts.es:
Mercy Marlene tiene 30 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Mercy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte y jugar con el hijo.
texts.en:
Mercy Marlene is 30 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and son in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  

The 'Tierra Nuestra' (Our Land) community bank is located in San Luis de Zapotal, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing crops such as corn and rice.

Mercy is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial AGRIPAC and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.  She is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy seeds and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as pests on her crops and a lack of money with which to pay more workers.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

Mercy enjoys taking part in sports and playing with her son.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar la chicha como maíz, jora y azúcar.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "MAMA SIMONA" which is in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Juana, 40, lives with her common-law husband and three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling chicha, which is a corn-based drink.  She works from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  With her income she has been able to provide for her children.  She would like to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy chicha ingredients such as corn, jora and sugar.

She is content with the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make chicha (corn drink), such as corn, jora and sugar.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer trabajadora de 32 años de edad. Ella vive en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque y goza de buenas referencias personales por ser empeñosa en la labor que realiza.

Mercedes se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral y cerdos, desde hace 3  años. Conoce su negocio a la perfección y cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Mercedes tiene muchos deseos de superación y se esmera en su trabajo para poder cumplir su meta principal que es mejorar su calidad  de vida.

Mercedes solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y el alimento balanceado que estos requieren. Además, arreglará su corral para darle una mejor crianza a sus cerdos y aves, con ello incrementará la producción de su negocio.

Mercedes es una clienta antigua de nuestra institución y cuenta con un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a hard-working, 32 year-old woman who lives in the rural part of Lambayeque district.  She has good personal references owing to the effort that she puts into her work.

Mercedes' business is raising and selling poultry and pigs.  She has been in this business for three years and knows it like the back of her hand.  She already has an established customer base in her area.  Mercedes has a great desire to do well and she does her work carefully so that she can achieve her main goal of improving her quality of life.

Mercedes is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals and the balanced feed that they need.  She will also fix her pen so that she can better raise her pigs and birds.  This will help her to increase her production.

Mercedes is a long-standing client of our institution and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed, and to fix her pen

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una luchadora incansable que después de separarse de su esposo, se vio en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio con el fin de cubrir los gastos del hogar y sostener a sus cuatro hijos, fue entonces cuando decidió vender chicles, confites y otros snaks por las calles del Centro de Medellín. Después con la ilusión de mejorar sus ingresos se ubicó en un puesto también en el centro de la ciudad y vender medias de hombre y mujer de todas las tallas. 

Actualmente Luz Marina necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor variedad de medias y así poder ofrecer diversidad a sus clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a tireless fighter who, after separating from her husband, needed to set up her own business with the goal of covering her household expenses and supporting her four children.  She decided to sell gum, candies and other snacks in the streets of Medellín city center.  Later, with the hope of improving her income, she set up a stall in the city center and started selling men's and women's socks in all sizes.

Luz Marina currently needs a loan to buy a wider variety of socks so that she can offer a better range to her customers and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of socks to improve her range

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Ollantaytambo, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 37 años; la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos, de 17 y 14 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la compra y veta de comidas en el mercado, la socia tiene un stand en el mercado en el cual prepara todo tipo de comidas caseras, la soca tiene su puesto y es muy conocida y cotizada , ella desea invertir en la compra de papas y aceite, la socia tiene planeado invertir en papas al por mayor comprara una arroba de papa peruanita y 1 arroba de papas blancas para freír, también comprara un bidón de 10 kilos de aceite para que le dure cerca de 2 meses, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de papas y aceite al por mayor.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO", which is in the Ollantaytambo District in the Urubamba Province, department of Cusco.

She is 37, married and has two children, ages 17 and 14.  She has a stand at the market where she sells all types of home-made meals.  She is well-known and popular, and wants to buy potatoes and oil on a wholesale basis.  She plans to buy an "arroba" (weight measurement) of Peruvian potatoes and an "arroba" of white potatoes for frying.  Also, she plans to buy 10 kilos of oil that will last her nearly two months. The loan will be used to buy the potatoes and oil wholesale.

She is very content and grateful for this support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and oil wholesale.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: El señor Ramón, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace muchos años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para poder darle el mantenimiento necesario que requiere la plantación , agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva , ya que sin estos programas ayuda no fuese posible sacar  una producción buena  ya que el préstamo se invierte en fertilizantes e insumos .
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife and children.  His plans for the future are to improve his lifestyle.  For several years he has been growing pineapple, with his greatest challenge being having enough capital to provide adequate maintenance for his plantation.

He is grateful for the confidence deposited in him by Afodenic through the Kiva fund, since he would be unable to achieve a good harvest without this type of program.  He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande- Piura, en la parte rural de este.

Francisco se dedica, desde hace 4 años, a la agricultura y ganadería. Cuenta con plantaciones de limón que cosecha semanalmente y  tiene un ganado ovino al cual le da los mejores cuidados para poder comercializarlos a mejor precio. Francisco cuenta con clientela establecida para ambos negocios.

Solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes que su cultivo de limón necesita, así como para el deshierbo y poda de este. Además, comprará alimento balanceado para el engorde de su ganado. 

Francisco tiene muchos deseos de superarse y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is 42 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in the rural part of Tambogrande- Piura district.

Francisco has been farming and raising livestock for four years.  He has lemon plantations which he harvests every week and also owns sheep which he provides with the best care so that he can sell them at the best possible price.  Francisco already has an established customer base for both businesses.

Francisco is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers that he needs for his lemon crop.  He will also weed and prune them.  In addition, he will buy balanced feed with which to fatten his livestock.

Francisco has a great desire to do well and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to weed and prune his crops

loans.name: Edwin Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin es soltero, tiene su casa propia,  se dedica a la compra y venta de alfalfa, comprando a los agricultores cercanos y vendiendo a los ganaderos y mercados de la localidad, viene laborando en este negocio por más de un año,  sus padres le han cedido un terreno para que pueda sembrar y cosechar  alfalfa y poder así crecer el negocio; su principal desafío que enfrenta Edwin es el frío por los lugares q recorre para poder vender su alfalfa y compartir su tiempo con el cuidado de sus padres ya que son ancianos y necesitan de su cuidado; sus sueños de Edwin es tener sus propias plantaciones  y comprar más terreno para ver crecer su negocio. El Sr. Edwin está muy agradecido  por el crédito dado a su persona.
texts.en: Mr. Edwin is single and lives in his own house.  He buys and sells alfalfa, buying from nearby farmers and selling to livestock farmers and markets in his town.  He has been in this business for over a year.  His parents are letting him use land to grow and harvest the alfalfa so he can expand his business.  The main challenge for Edwin is the cold weather he must face when selling his alfalfa and finding the time to care for his parents who are elderly and need his care.  Edwin's dream is to have his own plantations and buy more land to expand his business.  He is very grateful for this loan.

loans.use: To produce his own alfalfa and expand his business.

loans.name: Olga Natividad

texts.es:
Olga Natividad tiene 41 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 17, 13 y 10 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Olga se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es trabajar mucho para comprar terrenos por trabaja en terrenos arrendado.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo y compartir las cosas buenas con la familia.
texts.en:
Olga Natividad is 41 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and children, aged 17, 13 and 10, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  

The 'Tierra Nuestra' (Our Land) community bank is located in San Luis de Zapotal, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing crops such as corn and rice.

Olga is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial AGRIPAC and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.  She is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy seeds and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as pests on her crops and a lack of money with which to pay more workers.  Her dream is to work hard so that she can buy land as she currently works on rented land.

Olga enjoys working in the fields and sharing good times with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilaria; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende galletas, fideos, aceite y leche, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, galletas y aceite.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilaria belongs to the communal bank "Mama Simona."  This bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Hilaria is 47 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells cookies, noodles, cooking oil and milk, and she works from 6am until 10pm.  Hilaria wants to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting a loan to buy products for her grocery store such as: rice, sugar, cookies and cooking oil.

Hilaria is pleased to have this loan, and is committed to making all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, cookies and cooking oil

loans.name: Liliana Magdalena

texts.es:
Liliana es una clienta de 36 años de edad. Está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Ella vive con su familia en una zona urbana en vías de desarrollo del distrito de Chiclayo.

La actividad a la que se dedica, Liliana, es la venta de útiles escolares en su domicilio. Tiene 2 años de experiencia en este negocio y su demanda ha incrementado. Además, como negocio aparte, se dedica a la venta de cerveza.

Liliana solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles, que invertirá en la compra de mercadería de útiles escolares y en arreglos en el interior de su hogar.

Liliana es una clienta conocida de nuestra institución, este sería su tercer crédito y goza de buenas referencias personales y crediticias.
texts.en:
Liliana is a 36 year-old client who is married and has three children.  She lives with her family in a developing urban area in Chiclayo district.

Liliana's business is selling school supplies from her home.  She has two years experience in this business and her demand has increased.  She also has a business selling beer.

Liliana is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in buying school supplies and making some repairs to the inside of her home.

Liliana is a well-known client of our institution.  This will be her third loan and she has good personal and credit references.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and make some repairs to the inside of her home

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with six children, three boys and three girls. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She operates a water-vending business, selling from home to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other water vendors in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing rental houses in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to furnish her house, purchase sand and cement and pay for labor. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To furnish her house, purchase sand and cement and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ross Neri

texts.es:
Ross tiene 36 años de edad, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. La vivienda de Ross no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe.

Ross se dedica a la elaboración y venta de harina de Jora (maíz que se encuentra en el norte de l país). Además, cuenta con un ganado  ovino y terreno agrícola donde cosecha limón semanalmente. Ambos negocios cuentan con clientela establecida en el mercado de la localidad. Ross lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad.

Ross solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar el maíz que necesita para la elaboración de su harina, su demanda ha aumentado y es por ello que necesita incrementar su mercadería. También comprará alimento balanceado para sus ovinos, pues estos deben de tener un tamaño y peso adecuado para su óptima venta.

Ross tiene muchos deseos de crecer en sus negocios para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ross is 36 years old.  She is a widow and lives with her two children in the rural part of Tambogrande-Piura district.  Ross' home does not have basic services of electricity, water and sewerage.

Ross' business is making and seling Jora flour (Jora is a type of corn which is found in the north of the country).  She also owns sheep and farmland where she harvests lemons every week.  She has an established customer base for both of her businesses in the town market.  She has been in business for four years.

Ross is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy the corn that she needs to make her flour.  Her demand has risen and so she needs to increase her merchandise.  She will also buy balanced feed for her sheep as they must be a suitable weight and size in order to sell well.

Ross has a great desire to grow in her businesses so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn for making flour

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is 65 years old and lives in Pimampiro, Ecuador. He is single and lives with two of his youngest children. He is the father of six children, aged 37, 35, 33, 31, 17 and 11 years, respectively. He is very hardworking and has a deep love of agriculture. 

Luis is engaged in the cultivation of tree tomatoes and beans. Since he was very young and finished school at the age of 12, he has worked in the fields. He reports that his farming business is going well, depending on the season and the market. He is seeking this loan to buy agricultural inputs and fertilizer. 

Luis has been working with FODEMI since 2006. He says that the loans offer support that helps him keep his crops healthy to ensure a better livelihood for himself and his family. Luis’ dream for the future is to construct a bigger house with the money he makes from selling his agricultural products. He hopes to keep up his hard work with the help of microloans and pass on all his land to his six children so that they can continue with agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Encarnación, con doce miembros, está el comité denominado Kuña Guapa, el cual viene trabajando con la Fundación desde el año 2007. Todas las miembros van creciendo dentro del comité, dentro de un ambiente de respeto y responsabilidad. Actualmente se encuentran en el ciclo numero once.
Las mujeres son muy trabajadoras, desde el primer ciclo han demostrado su responsabilidad y entusiasmo. Todas están con miras hacia un objetivo común, que es el de generar mayores ingresos, con lo cual podrán mejorar su nivel de vida.
La Sra Angelica tiene una despensa, ella es muy conocida en el barrio ya qyue la mayoría de sus vecinos siempre van a comprar de su tiendita. Por medio de este negocio ha podido obtener un poco mas de ingresos con lo cual puede abastecer su negocio y mejorar su estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecer su despensa con comestibles, lácteos, bebida y demás.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee has 12 members and is located in the city of Encarnación.  The group have been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2007.  All the members are growing within the committee, in an environment of respect and responsibility.  They are currently on their eleventh loan cycle.

The women are very hard working.  Since their first loan cycle they have shown responsibility and enthusiasm.  They are all aiming towards a common goal which is to make more income so that they can improve their standard of living.

Angelica has a grocery store.  She is very well known in her neighborhood as most of her neighbors come to buy from her small store.  Through this business, she has been able to earn a little more income which she can use to stock her business and improve her lifestyle.

Angelica is requesting a loan to stock her store with groceries, dairy products, drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dairy products, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Ollantaytambo, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 47 años; la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos, los hijos de la socia dos de ellos son independientes y los otros dos tiene 18 y 12 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la artesanía, la socia tiene su stand en la estación antes de ir a Machupicchu, la socia trabaja desde hace 4 años en la compra y venta de artesanías y esta agregada en la asociación de artesanos de Ollantaytambo; la socia tiene sus proveedores de artesanías como adornos en cerámicas, llaveros, pendientes, gorros de lana, guantes, tejidos de alpaca y de lana de oveja, como chompas, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de artesanía, tales como textiles y un poco de adornos en cerámica, hecha en arcilla y pintada con paisajes andinos. La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de artesanía.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This woman is a member of the communal bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo."  This bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district of Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco.

This member is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Two of her children are independent and the others are 18 and 12 years old.  She has a business selling crafts at a stand at the train station to Machupicchu.  She has been buying and selling handicrafts for 4 years, and she is a member of the Association of Artisans of Ollantaytambo.  She has her suppliers of handicrafts such as decorative ceramic pieces, key chains, earrings, wool caps, gloves, and items knitted from alpaca and sheep's wool such as sweaters.  She wants to invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of more handicrafts such as textiles and some decorative pottery pieces made from clay and painted with Andean landscapes.  She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of more handicrafts.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support that will be provided through these means, and she is committed to making all of the payments on her loan according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is a 36-year-old married man with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Ut and his wife earn a living to support their family by selling everyday items such as combs and toothpicks as well as small kitchen appliances and accessories from a stall near his house. He and his wife have been running their stall for five years. 

Ut intends to take loan to expand his business by buying a greater range of kitchen, bathroom and everyday items to attract more customers. He hopes that, through the loan, the turnover of his business will increase and he will be abL. to generate a higher income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy kitchen and bathroom accessories to sell in his stall.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a married woman with three boys; two attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and clothing.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business and also sells fresh water to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing a water-selling stall in the future.

With the 100,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to renovate her retail shop and purchase cement, sand and blocks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her retail shop and purchase cement, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en:
Anjeline is a married woman with four boys, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills and clothing.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other poultry operators. Her major goal is to expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase chicken feed and more chicks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed and more chicks.

loans.name: Gildas Regis

texts.fr:
Client de 28 ans, marie avec 1 enfant a sa charge, a l'arret de ses etudes par faute de soutien en classe de 5e, il se lance dans le commerce des habits hommes et enfants, ses ventes sont de 30000 frs a 40000frs par jour .

A l'octroi de son pret , il veut acheter des polos , chemises et marinieres pour homme et des habits pour enfants.

Tres entreprenant, il a pour ambition d'ouvrir une boutique d'habits pour homme et enfant, il epargne beaucoup et il soutien sa famille avec les benefices de son activite.
texts.en:
This borrower is 28 years old and married with one dependent child. He quit school in the fifth grade for lack of financial support, and started to sell clothing for men and children. His sales average 30,000 to 40,000F per day.

With this loan, he plans to buy polo shirts, dress shirts and middy blouses for men, and children’s clothes.

He is a very enterprising man whose goal is to open a clothing store for men and children. He saves a lot, and he supports his family with the revenue from his activity.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts and other shirts for men, and children’s clothes

loans.name: Leonor Del Rosario

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 23 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo y 2 hijos en el distrito de Mórrope en Lambayeque. Esta es una zona rural cuya principal actividad es la agricultura y ganadería. Leonor y su familia viven en una pequeña comunidad de aproximadamente 80 familias.

Leonor se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace 6 años. Pero también cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa en su propio domicilio. Leonor les vende prendas a los habitantes de su zona y cuenta con clientela fija que constantemente le hacen pedidos.

Leonor es una mujer  trabajadora y sacrificada a su familia., ella tiene muchos deseos de superación y desea invertir en ambos negocios. Este es el motivo que la ha llevado a solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con el cuál comprará prendas de vestir para su venta y alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus animales.

Leonor es una clienta antigua de nuestra institución y goza de un buen historial crediticio por su responsabilidad en la cancelación de sus pagos.
texts.en:
Leonor is 23 years old.  She lives together with her husband and two children in Mórrope district, in Lambayeque.  This is a rural area whose main business activity is farming and livestock raising.  Leonor and her family live in a small community of approximately 80 families.

Leonor has been raising and selling animals for six years.  However, she also has a business selling clothes from her home.  She sells the clothes to people in her area and has regular customers who are constantly making orders with her.

Leonor is a hard-working woman who makes sacrifices for her family.  She has a great desire to do well and would like to invest in both of her businesses.  This is the motivation that led her to request a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the money to buy clothes to sell and also balanced feed with which to fatten her animals.

Leonor is a long-standing client of our institution and she has a good credit record as she has shown responsibility in paying back her loans.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with two boys and one girl. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and clothing. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 35,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Santa Marta Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Santa Marta, se conformó en el 2008, gracias a que una de las miembro había contactado con la asesora quien  tenía un grupo en la misma zona. Se informó del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el  8º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
 Es un excelente grupo, el cual gracias al  trabajo solidario realizado  continúan trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella posee ya una buena cantidad de clientas que siempre le hacen pedidos. Ella esta muy feliz con su trabajo, ya que le encanta vender productos de belleza. Su trabajo le genera buenos ingresos, con lo cual puede cubrir sus gastos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de mas cosméticos, con lo cual podrá atraer a mas clientas.
texts.en:
The Santa Marta Women's Committee was formed in 2008 thanks to one of its members who contacted a loan officer who was working with a group in the same area.  She found out about the Entrepreneurial Women's Committee Program and, once she had been advised about the program, she managed to get together 15 women who are working very happily on their eighth loan cycle.  They are working jointly and in a supportive manner within the program.

This is an excellent group who, through their joint work, are continuing to work within the program.

Maria sells cosmetics.  She has a good number of customers who are always placing orders with her.  She is very happy with her work as she loves selling beauty products.  Her work makes her good income with which she is able to cover her expenses.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy more cosmetics which will enable her to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with seven children, six boys and one girl, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and clothing.

For the past eight years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also owns real estate houses, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition from other charcoal sellers in the area. 

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase 50 sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of purchasing a motorcycle to start another business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 50 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with two children, one attends school while one graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and electricity .

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetable-stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable-stall operators. She dreams of owning a retail shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es:
Omar de 37 años se dedica al comercio de cerdo, queso, suero, miel de abeja y gallinas criollas, desde hace 12 años, estos  productos los trae de un pueblo llamado Chibolo en el departamento del Magdalena y que cuenta con un poco más de 16.000 habitantes, valles fluviales, algunas elevaciones de tierra,  sitio que Omar recuerda con mucha alegría porque de allí es oriundo.  
Su negocio inició cuando se puso de acuerdo con un amigo para vender algo y Omar escogió la venta de cerdo, pues tenía conocidos con mucha experiencia en su natal Chibolo. Empezó de casa en casa vendiéndolo hasta que logró una clientela un poco estable. Posteriormente adicionó  un punto de venta dominical y agregó otros productos como queso suero, miel de abejas, y gallinas criollas. El cerdo los comercializa los fines de semana, con un promedio de 40 a 50kls, cuenta con una muy buena clientela entre sus familiares, amigos y vecinos; su negocio no tiene endeudamiento, todas sus compras las hace de contado y las ventas de estos productos en su mayoría  también son de contado. Sus ventas le permiten cubrir costos y genera una utilidad que le permiten cubrir sus gastos familiares; sus índices de liquidez son buenos y suficientes para cancelar la  obligación que planea con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Sus cuentas por cobrar rotan rápidamente lo mismo que sus inventarios. Sus niveles de rentabilidad demuestran la eficiencia  y solvencia del negocio para compromisos futuros. Como Omar quiere crecer cada día más, requiere para atender su nueva clientela un poco más de capital de trabajo, esta es la razón por la cual recurre a su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el propósito de comprar cerdo en mayores cantidades, pues quiere ampliar el número de días en los cuales vende y ofrecer mejores precios porque planea obtener descuentos por compra en volúmenes.
texts.en: Omar is 37 years old and he has been selling pigs, cheese, whey protein, honey, and poultry for the past 12 years. He brings these products from a village called Chibolo in the department of Magdalena. It is known to have more than 16000 inhabitants, alluvial plains, and a few hills. As a native of the region Omar thinks about this place very fondly. He stated out his business when he came into an agreement with a friend to sell something and Omar chose the sale of pork meat. He knew many individuals with much experience in his native town of Chibolo. He started out selling from door to door until he gained a somewhat stable clientele. Later he started out selling form his home and he added other products for sale, such as cheese, whey protein, honey, and poultry. He sells pork on the weekends, averaging between 40 to 50 kilograms. He has a very good clientele among his family, friends, and neighbors. His business is not credit-based. All of his purchases are done in cash and product sales are also for the most part completed in cash. His sales cover his costs and generate a profit that permits him to cover the family's expenses. His liquidity index ratio is good and it is sufficient to fulfill the commitment he plans on undertaking with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). His accounts receivable have a fast turn around as does his inventory. His profitability margins show the efficiency and solvency of the business for future commitments. Omar wants to grow more each day and he needs an additional working capital to attend to his new clientele. For this reason he requests a Kiva loan. it is the first loan that he has with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. He plans on purchasing pork meat in larger quantities. He also wants to increase the days when he makes his ales and to offer better prices. He plans on obtaining discounts through volume purchases.

loans.use: to purchase pork meat in larger quantities.

loans.name: Morin Bernard

texts.fr:
Client de 35 ans, marie et pere de 4 enfant dont l'age varie entre 2 et 8 ans.En 2009 ayant perdu son emploi, il se lance dans la patisserie pour subvenir au besoin de sa famille.Il avait achete un four artisanal, des moules a cake et brioches , de la farine et des condiments pour l'ouverture.
Ses potentiels clients sont les eleves,les collegiens et lyceens et  les vendeurs du marche.
Ses ventes sont de 7500 a 50.000 frs par jour.

A l'octroi de son pret il va acheter 2 sacs de farine de 50 kg,50 l d'huile d'arachide,sac de 50kg de sucre, de  la levure chimique et levure patissiere , du sel, 50kg de margarine et un sac de 50kg de lait.

A la longue , il veut ouvrir une patisserie moderne ,moderniser ses equipements et ouvrir un salon de the et avec ses benefices , il prendra soins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This customer is 35 years old, married, and a father of four children between the ages of two and eight.
In 2009, after losing his job, he ventured into pastry-making to provide for his family. To open the business, he purchased an artisan oven, cake and bun pans, flour and flavorings. His potential clients are schoolchildren, middle and high-school students, and the market's salespeople. His daily sales vary between 7,500 and 50,000 XAF.
When the loan is granted, he will purchase two 50-kilo bags of flour, 50 liters of peanut oil, a 50-kilo bag of sugar, baking powder and yeast, salt, 50 kilos of margarine, and a 50-liter container of milk.
In the long run, he wants to open a modern pastry shop, to modernize his equipment and to open a tea room. With the profits, he will take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy two bags of flour, 50 kilos of sugar, 25 kilos of margarine, salt, sugar and 50 liters of peanut oil.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre San José  fue conformada en desD. el 2010, fue conformada gracias a la iniciativa D. la Sra. Elsa quien animada por un grupo D. mujeres decidieron conformar el comité, el cual actualmente trabaja en forma excelente con  responsabilidad, honestidad y han demostrado en todos los emprendimientos que les toco llevar  que se sienten muy bien trabajando en el grupo. El comité está integrado por 11 mujeres, todas ellas trabajadoras y luchadoras.
La Sra. Elsa es decoradora, ella se define como una mujer creativa y llena D. imaginación. Le encanta lo que hace, ya que por medio D. u trabajo pueD. demostrar toda la creatividad que tiene. 
Elsa tiene un grupo D. clientes que siempre acuden a ella en caso D. fiestas y demás, para que sea ella quien decore. Sueña con algún dia poder tener un local con todo lo necesatio para la decoración D. grandes fiestas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas para la decoración, como asi también D. globos y demás, ya que le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The San José Women's Committee was formed in 2010 thanks to the initiative of Elsa who, encouraged by a group of women, decided to form a committee.  The members of the committee are currently working very well together with responsibility and honesty.  They have shown, in all the undertakings they have maD., that they feel very happy working as a group.  The committee is maD. up of 11 hard-working and tenacious women.

Elsa is a decorator.  She describes herself as a creative woman who is full of imagination.  She loves what she does as, through her work, she is able to demonstrate all the creativity that she has.

Elsa has a group of customers who always come to her when they are planning parties and other events so that she can decorate for them.  She dreams of some day having premises with everything she needs for decorating large parties.

Elsa is requesting a loan to buy decorative materials, balloons, etc.  This will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy decorative materials, balloons, etc.

loans.name: Messie

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Messie. She is married and has three children, aged 28, 25 and 22. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she is her mother. In 1990, Messie established her timber business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in the running of the home, and that is her major source of income. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Messie requires a loan in order to buy a power saw. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Messie plans to get more power saws, educate her children and to own a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a power saw.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: La cliente Wimana, leader du groupe d’affaire « Espoir », est entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous et 4 autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse des souliers. Son mari est un ancien fonctionnaire passionné (mise en retraite). Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal de  CADECO- Ville. Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  15 pairs de souliers à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  construire une maison à mettre a location.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Espoir » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Wimana, an entrepreneur, is the head of the business group "Espoir" (hope) which consists mostly of women. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 10 children who go to school, and 4 more who now live on their own. She sells shoes, and her husband is a former civil servant who is now retired. 

She displays her merchandise at the communal market of CADECO-Ville.  She has been conducting small-scale income-generating activities such as this for 10 years, and she just completed her 10th loan cycle with the Hekima microfinance institution.

She will use this new loan to replenish her stock with 15 pairs of shoes. She wants to provide her children with an education, and build a house to use as a rental property. 

Wimana thanks the Hekima MFI for helping poor women who do not have access to traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman with two girls who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water bills, electricity bills and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing poultry feeds in her business. Fatuma dreams of purchasing more chicks and supplying as a wholesaler in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase 50 chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 50 chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Elman Santiago

texts.es: El señor Elman, es habitante del municipio de Níndiri, Masaya, junto a su esposa e  hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Elman desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de de yuca, la mayor afectación que se le presenta es el robo del producto, el financiaminto lo quiere para la comra de fertilizantes ,madera , aradado , etc. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de fondo Kiva ya que es un beneficio para muchos agricultores ya que si esta muy cuidado el producto asi tendran una mejor venta .
texts.en: Elman is originally from the municipality of Mindiri in Masaya. He lives together with his wife and children. His plans for the future are to improve their living conditions. Elman has been cultivating yucca for many years. The greatest challenge is the theft of the product. He will invest the loan in fertilizer, wood, a plow, etc. He is thankful to Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner), operating through Kiva, for the support provided, as it provides a great benefit for many farmers, since being very protective of crops will make for good sales.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm equipment.

loans.name: María Mariela

texts.es:
María Mariela es una emprendedora innata, pues desde pequeña siempre le ha gustado trabajar como independientes, es así, como hace algunos años, decidió montar su propio negocio de helados ya que en el barrio donde vive no cuenta con competencia directa. 

María Mariela trabaja de domingo a domingo, los fines de semana cuenta con el apoyo de esposo quien le ayuda en la atención a los clientes. 

Actualmente María Mariela necesita de un préstamo para comprar un congelador, pues el que tiene es arrendado, así podrá adquirir uno más grande e incluir mayor variedad de helados, así mismo necesita realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas y comprar insumos para la preparación de las copas que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Mariela is a born entrepreneur.  She has always enjoyed working independently since she was a young girl.  Some years ago, she decided to set up her own business selling iced treats as there was no direct competition in her neighborhood.

María Mariela works from Sunday to Sunday.  On weekends she has the support of her husband who helps her to serve her customers.

María Mariela currently needs a loan to buy a freezer as the one she has now is rented.  She would like to buy a bigger one so that she can offer a wider variety of iced treats.  She also needs to make some improvements to her premises and buy supplies for preparing the drinks that she sells to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, make some improvements to her premises, and buy supplies

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four children, two boys and two girls. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills. 

For the past 15 years, she has operated a vegetable-stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable operators in her area. Her dream is to own a plot of land in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To  purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de piscigranja que es un lugar donde cría pescados y truchas y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados, a restaurants y también al público en general, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de piscigranja. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los peces y truchas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Mama Simona". It is located in the district of Cusco, of the department and province of Cusco. 

Her name is Fortunata. She is 44 years old, married, and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her fish farm business. A fish farm is a place where fish and trout are grown and later sold to the different markets, restaurants, and to the general public. She wants to expand her fish farm business. she requests a loan to purchase feed for fish and trout.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fish and trout.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estela; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y jora.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y jora.
texts.en:
Señora Estela is a member of the communal bank "Mama Simona".  The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco. 

She is 32 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling chicha, a beverage made from corn.  She sells as a street vendor from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  Through this business she has been able to provide for her children.  She wants to expand her chicha sales business.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn and jora [a type of corn used to make chicha].  

                      
                                                                                                 .

loans.use: purchase corn and jora.

loans.name: Gbedokpo Zongo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDOKPO ZONGO  est composé de cinq personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. C'est la première  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Geneviève est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Geneviève  est âgée de 43 ans et vit au Bénin. Geneviève est mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Imorou. Le couple à trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Geneviève vit depuis sa naissance au Bénin. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Geneviève vend depuis dix ans des sachets d'eau. A côté de cette activité,  Geneviève vend des fripperies au Bénin. Geneviève s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Geneviève sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO ZONGO, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
Group Gbedokpo Zongo is composed of five people living in the same house. This is the first time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support to increase their level of activity.
The group's spokesperson, named Geneviève, is the woman raising her hand in the picture. Geneviève is 43 years old and lives in Benin. Geneviève is married to an entrepreneur named Imorou. The couple has three children, who all go to school, and whom they still support. Geneviève has lived in Benin since she was born.
To provide for her and her children's needs, Geneviève has been selling water pouches for ten years. In addition to this activity, Geneviève sells second-hand clothing in Benin. She gets her supplies from Benin.
Intent on satisfying her customers and to increase her sales and profit, Geneviève is requesting a first loan together with group Gbedokpo Zongo's other members.

loans.use: to buy water pouches and second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La señora Reina trabaja como costurera en una fabrica de costura en la ciudad de La Paz y su esposo trabaja como albañil. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de 2 maquinas de costurar pues su deseo abrir su propio taller y de esta manera tener mayor libertad de acción y decisión para mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en anticretico en una casa la misma queda ubicada en la zona de 3 de mayo en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Señora Reina works as a seamstress in a clothing factory in the city of La Paz.  Her husband works as a mason.  She is requesting a loan to purchase 2 sewing machines because she wants to open her own shop.  This way she will have more freedom to act and make decisions to increase her income. She lives in an anticretico house [a transaction where in exchange for housing the renter loans the owner money which is returned at the end of the contract] in the May 3rd district in the city of La Paz.  She is married and has one child.  This is her first loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: purchase two sewing machines so that she can start her own seamstress business.
